title.justification: This is the title of the paper as provided by the user and found at the top of the document.

extractions.description: The paper discusses the Asteroid Routing Problem (ARP), which focuses on optimizing spacecraft trajectories to visit a set of moving asteroids. The authors propose the first exact solution to the ARP using decision diagrams and introduce the peel-and-bound method for solving optimization problems. They also elaborate on generating heuristic search techniques for global trajectory optimization problems.

type.justification: The paper presents a new theoretical approach to solving the Asteroid Routing Problem (ARP) using decision diagrams and introduces various methodologies like peel-and-bound. It does not focus on empirical study but rather on the formulation and theoretical discussion of these methods.
type.quote: We provide the first exact solution to the Asteroid Routing Problem by using a method of solving optimization problems with decision diagrams called peel-and-bound.

name.justification: The primary research field of this paper is Combinatorial Optimization as it focuses on optimizing the trajectories in the Asteroid Routing Problem (ARP) using decision diagrams.
name.quote: We provide the first exact solution to the Asteroid Routing Problem by using a method of solving optimization problems with decision diagrams called peel-and-bound.

name.justification: Dynamic Programming is a significant part of the methodology used in this paper for decision diagrams and optimization problems.
name.quote: Keywords: Decision Diagrams · Spacecraft Trajectory Optimization · Dynamic Programming · Combinatorial Optimization

name.justification: The paper discusses the optimization of spacecraft trajectories on a global scale, particularly focused on space missions involving asteroids.
name.quote: We also discuss how this methodology can be used to generate new heuristic search techniques for global trajectory optimization problems.
